display_long_description:
[Mode Description]
・A Mode: Original Stage [Fixed Target] (10 Stages)
・B Mode: Original Stage [Moving Target] (10 Stages)
・C Mode: JSC Competition Stage (8 Stages)
・D Mode: JTSA Competition Stage [UNLIMITED & LIMITED] (10 Stages)
・Training Mode: Practice each stage repeatedly.
・Reflex Training Mode: Practice mode where you quickly defeat randomly appearing targets one by one.

In modes A to D, you will play each stage three times.
The fastest time of the three times will be recorded as the total time for all stages.
If you play from the second time onwards, if your new time is faster than your 
previous best time, your record will be updated.
Pressing the reset button will reset your best time.

[Perfect for PS Division Practice]
All stages feature a Point Start (PS) mark.
After pressing the Start button, you must aim at the PS mark in front of the box 
and wait until the buzzer sounds.
When the buzzer sounds, you must shoot all targets according to the stage rules.
 (You cannot fire until the buzzer sounds)

[ About Muzzle Management ]
The angle at which the muzzle can be pointed is less
than 90 degrees to the left and right from the front.
If you point the muzzle further back, 
you will be disqualified as a competition rule.

[Japan Airsoft Competition Related Websites]
JSC: https://www.japansteelchallenge.org/
JTSA: https://jtsa-shooting.org/
